snippet: George Zimmerman, who is charged with second-degree murder in the killing of Trayvon Martin, was chastised by a judge as “flaunting the system.”
abstract: Florida Judge Kenneth R Lester Jr rules that George Zimmerman, charged with second-degree murder in the killing of Trayvon Martin, can be released from jail on a $1 million bond; Lester chastises Zimmerman for acting in concert with his wife to mislead the court about his finances during an earlier bond hearing, at which a $150,000 bond was established.
lead_paragraph: George Zimmerman, who is charged with second-degree murder in the killing of Trayvon Martin, was chastised by a judge as “flaunting the system.”

headline.seo: Bond Set for Zimmerman in Trayvon Martin Shooting
headline.main: New Bond of $1 Million in Trayvon Martin Killing
headline.print_headline: New Bond of $1 Million In Trayvon Martin Killing
